title: SpaceX
summary: Space Exploration Technologies Corp., commonly known as SpaceX, is a private American aerospace company headquartered in Starbase, Texas. Founded by Elon Musk in 2002, the company aims to reduce space launch costs and enable Mars colonization. SpaceX has made significant advances in rocket propulsion, reusable launch vehicles, human spaceflight, and satellite constellation technology. As of 2025, SpaceX is the world's dominant space launch provider, working closely with NASA and the U.S. Armed Forces.
structure: Launch market competition and pricing pressure

factual.claim: SpaceX successfully launched two NASA astronauts into orbit in May 2020
Starlink generated the bulk of SpaceX's income

interpretive.statement: SpaceX portrayed as transformative force in space exploration
Company positioned as dominant space launch provider

last_updated: June 2025 (content references events up to June 2025)
